statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Elon 58, South Carolina 53
article.story: ELON, N.C. -- Elon refused to relinquish its lead in the second half despite South Carolina's effort to change the complexion of Tuesday night's game. The result was a breakthrough victory for the Southern Conference school. Lucas Troutman scored 16 points and Austin Hamilton added 12 as Elon held off South Carolina 58-53. "I'm glad we didn't have to experience what it would be like if they did take the lead," Elon coach Matt Matheny said. "We played well enough defensively to win the game." The Phoenix (1-1) never trailed in the second half as Elon upended the first power-conference team to visit Alumni Gym, its on-campus facility. It took the Gamecocks (1-1) more than 15 minutes to take their only lead and that edge lasted just one possession. South Carolina missed all 12 of its first-half 3-point shots. South Carolina coach Darrin Horn said perimeter shooting was "an area that we think is going to be a strength for us this year." Anthony Gill and Malik Cooke scored nine points apiece for the Gamecocks, who shot 31.3 percent from the field (20 of 64). "We were able to get up in them on defense," Troutman said. Elon led 34-23 at halftime after Brett Ervin's third 3-pointer. "We needed a run late in the half because I thought we had played pretty good," Matheny said. South Carolina closed to within one point twice in the second half, the final time at 45-44 with 8:55 remaining. "I thought it would have changed things for both teams (if we could have gone ahead)," Horn said. "Credit them; they made some big shots when they had them." Hamilton, a freshman guard, made his first career start. He filled in for Jack Isenbarger, who missed the game with a shoulder injury suffered in Elon's opener Friday night at Massachusetts. "Getting a win like that is incredible," Hamilton said. "I'm glad I'm here."
